so verwachst das grosse Blut gefass und die 
Placenta fallt ab-“ p.400-
After what has been stated concerning the 
development of the two forms of the Salpae - it 
would be useless to enter upon the consideration 
of the various theories propounded since the 
time of Chamisso - (such as that of 
Eschricht for instance) to account for 
the phenomena they present -
It may be sufficient to say that it 
is now quite certain that the salpae never 
unite after being once separated, and that 
they do not produce [text?] broods of a 
different form -
Much remains to be done with regard 
to the minute process of development of the 
young forms of both kinds - and to this 
difficult inquiry it is to be hoped that future 
observers will address themselves -
